The crystal structure constant b equals 1.105 for fcc and hcp clusters, 1.137 for bcc clusters [ 1], 1.488 for simple cubic clusters, and 1.517 for diamond cubic clusters. As is shown above, the formula for FE is a ratio of a quadratic to a cubic for the clusters and can be modeled by a power law curve fit versus d
rel . The variable d
rel allows us to compare different clusters to one another without regard to the crystal structure. For some of the Platonic clusters, where there is no crystal unit cell, we use
